docs.text: well , in any event , that is the situation hank ( paxton ) finds himself in .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he and his dim-witted brother jacob ( thorton ) and tubby friend lou ( brent briscoe ) come upon a large bag of cash inside a plane wreck .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: against his better judgement , hank decides to go along with the idea of keeping it rather than going to the authorities .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the rest of the film is a question of who is going to die to keep this a secret , and is it worth it ?

docs.text: sam raimi took a departure from his normal freak-show horror-monkey films and made this stylish and intriguing picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he really lets the audience sit back and watch the events unfold rather than force them down our throats as many directors prefer to do .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i think raimi knew he had a winner on his hands and decided to direct the picture on a natural flowing course .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of the film's components can be linked to a recurring theme in terrence malick's the thin red line .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in malick's three hour bore-a-thon , he makes an interesting attempt to link mother earth to his war story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it seemed nothing more than an occasional pretty cut to a field of flowing grass , a small bird , or a flowing body of water .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sure , there were obvious metaphorical connections , but there was no subtlty to his efforts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: raimi does a fine job of tying in a fox in a chicken coop and birds of prey to signify the future of the characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i think most viewers may miss the comparison , but it is a very intriguing ingredient in the film .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and then there's billy bob thorton , who is proof that the independent film industry is vital to the life blood of hollywood .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if it can continute to produce people like thorton , hollywood will be ok .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he gives a fantastic and devastatingly deep performance here .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is not as engrossing as his carl childers character in slingblade , but is is just as complex , if not more so .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jacob is slow and simple , and yet we so often see him deep in thought .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i wondered if he was thinking about things that he would never say ( or didn't know how to say ) or if he was just taking a long time to think about the thing he just said .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: here he really proves his worth as one of the best character actors in the industry .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: though the plot is somewhat unoriginal , it has a very appealing new twist in its characters .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: paxton gives one of the better performances of his career as the straight and serious leader of the group ( a far cry from chet in wierd science ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps bridget fonda is miscast as his advice-giving wife , but she certainly doesn't do anything ruin the picture .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a simple plan can be included in the group of recent small hollywood films that is just dark and pretty un-redeeming .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but at least this one has an important message , unlike so many of its counterparts .
